question_text: Why might an administrator prefer a hardware tap over port mirroring in high-throughput environments?
answer_options: Taps eliminate the need for monitoring software
Port mirroring can introduce latency or packet loss under heavy loads
Port mirroring requires physical access to the router
correct_answer: Port mirroring can introduce latency or packet loss under heavy loads
explanation: Under high traffic volumes, software-based port mirroring may not keep up with the data rate, while hardware taps copy all traffic reliably.
